Leading the challenge behind him is Australian Cameron Smith, on six under, with South Korea's Im Sung-jae, runner-up alongside Smith in 2020, two shots further back.
The 25-year-old Texan shot a one-under 71 on Saturday but threw away a six-shot lead over the chasing pack after carding four bogeys in the final seven rounds.
World No 1 Scottie Scheffler will go into the final round at the Masters in Augusta defending a three-shot lead in a bid to win his first major.
Shane Lowry, of Ireland, and Charl Schwartzel, of South Africa, who won at Augusta in 2011, are seven shots behind.
